newsitem.title: USA: FileNet sees Q2 EPS loss after charges.
newsitem.headline: FileNet sees Q2 EPS loss after charges.

text.p: FileNet Corp said Wednesday it expects to report a second quarter net loss of about $3.8 million or $0.25 per share, including restructuring and other charges of $6 million, on revenue of about $62.5 million.
The company said income before the charges will be about $0.5 million or $0.03 per share on about 15.4 million shares outstanding.
According to First Call, analysts on average expect a second quarter per share loss of $0.14.
The restructuring and other charges relate to the consolidation of its Burlington, Mass., engineering and marketing functions and additional headcount reductions, the company said.
FileNet said it reported net income of $2.5 million or $0.15 per share, on revenue of $65 million for the second quarter of 1996.
For the six months ended June 30,1997, the company said it expects to report a loss before after-tax charges of about $8.9 million or $0.59 per share on revenue of about $110.1 million.
The six month loss after charges is expected to be about $13.2 million, or $0.88 per share compared with a net loss of $9.3 million or $0.62 per share in the same period last year.

"I was encouraged by the rebound in domestic orders from the first quarter level," said chief executive Ted Smith in a statement. "Our international business was strong in all areas except Europe where orders remained weak. We are optimistic that our Europe business will rebound in the third quarter."
The company expects to announce final results on July 23.
